intro: Ferdinandea ovalis, commonly known as the oval fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive oval-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Ferdinandea ovalis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth.
